description: From Latin oppidum (“(chiefly walled or fortified) town”).

entries.meaning: A large, defended Iron Age settlement associated with the Celtic La Tène culture. [from 19th c.]
examples: ‘Mount Ceasar’ was a major oppidum of the Bellovaci tribe and almost certainly the tribal capital: its geographical relationship to the nearby Roman capital of Beauvais is typical of a post-conquest tribal resettlement.
